name: Dog Health Quiz | Dog Health | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is poisonous to dogs?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate.

	The chemical theobromine in chocolate is very toxic to dogs, and there is no antidote. Baker's chocolate is the most toxic; milk chocolate the least. An 8-ounce bar of baker's chocolate can kill a small dog. Keep chocolate out of reach!

questions.text: You are contemplating purchasing a golden retriever puppy. In the USA, which of the following certifications should the parents have had before breeding?
options: No health testing is needed, especially for just a pet dog.
questions.explanation:
Both OFA and CERF.

	OFA -Orthopedic Foundation for Animals- assures that a dog does not have the crippling disorder hip dysplasia. CERF -Canine Eye Registry Foundation- checks for genetic eye disorders. Both certifications are important - especially for a healthy pet! Responsible breeders always health-test their breeding stock.

questions.text: Which of the following places should be your last choice, as a place to ethically purchase a puppy?
questions.explanation:
A pet store.

	Most pet store pups come from horrible places called puppymills, where the parent dogs are literally bred to death. Such puppies are unhealthy and rarely look or act like the breed they are supposed to be. NO responsible breeder sells puppies to a pet store. Responsible breeders want to know what happens to their puppies, not send them off to an unknown fate to be sold to anyone with the cash to buy them.

questions.text: Why shouldn't you leave your dog in a car at the shopping center?
options: It could panic and damage the car
questions.explanation:
All of these reasons.

	All of these are good reasons. Dogs have much less capacity to cool themselves than humans do, so they overheat easily. Many dogs die in hot cars every year. In addition, dogs can be stolen from cars or ruin them!

questions.text: Which of these leads to the highest death toll in dogs in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Behavior problems.

	Over 20 million dogs are killed in shelters and pounds every year in the USA, and untold numbers of dogs are abandoned. The most common reason that people dispose of a dog is behavior problems- most of which are easily cured with knowledgeable training.

questions.text: You have a beautiful female Collie with no pedigree. She has had no health testing, has never competed in any performance events, and her conformation has never been evaluated. Is it a good idea to breed from her?
questions.explanation:
No.

	In a society where millions of dogs are killed yearly, untested dogs of unknown lineage should never be bred. All breeding should be to benefit the breed involved. No scientific study has ever shown that such poor breeding practices- or deliberate breeding of mixed breeds- produces healthier dogs. The healthiest dogs come from health-tested parents of known ancestry.

questions.text: Spaying and neutering have important health and behavioral benefits for ______ .
questions.explanation:
male and female dogs.

	Spaying protects a female from mammary and ovarian cancer. Neutering protects males from testicular and prostate cancer and makes them less inclined to roam, fight, and mark.

questions.text: Your large-breed dog is pacing and panting. He is drooling and trying to vomit, but nothing is coming up. You notice that his abdomen is beginning to swell. He may have which of these?
questions.explanation:
bloat.

	Bloat is a medical emergency! Untreated, it leads to stomach twisting and death in most dogs. It is especially common in large, deep-chested dogs like Irish Setters and Great Danes. If your dog shows such symptoms, get him to the vet immediately!

questions.text: Most dogs will exercise themselves if they have a large enough yard.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Most dogs will not self-exercise. They need interaction in order to do so.

questions.text: In the early twenty-first century, most dogs in the United States are overweight.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Up to 60 percent of dogs are overweight. If you place your hands over your dog's ribcage, you should be able to feel his ribs easily. If not, your dog is probably overweight.
